text: Sister Mary T. Clark, RSCJ (October 23, 1913 â€“ September 1, 2014) was an Americans educator and civil rights advocate. She was best known as a scholar of the history of philosophy, and was associated especially with Augustine of Hippo. She was formerly the President of the American Catholic Philosophical Association of the Metaphysical Society of America, and of the Society for Medieval and Renaissance Philosophy. She also served on the Executive Committee of the Eastern Division of the American Philosophical Association. She served as a Visitor of Ralston College. Clark died in Savannah, Georgia from natural causes, aged 100. ==Other websites== * Manhattanville College * The Society of the Sacred Heart * Mary T.
